alert.note: Alert for Yavapai County Mountains; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 5:05PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Yavapai County along I-40 through 530 PM MST... At 503 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a several strong thunderstorms near Bumble Bee, or 20 miles north of New River, moving southeast at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rock Springs, Bumble Bee and Black Canyon City. This includes Interstate 17 between mile markers 242 and 258. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding and reduced visibility. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Practice caution as heavy rain may be displacing rocks onto the road.
